intro: Lapidaria margaretae, commonly known as the margaretae rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the rocky habitats of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth form. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hair, which helps to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Lapidaria margaretae is well adapted to poor, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
